html: I’m delighted that my bill to ban gag clauses that prevent pharmacists from telling patients how to pay the lowest possible price for medication is headed to the President’s desk for signature. This new law will help lower the cost of prescription drugs and save consumers money.
text: I’m delighted that my bill to ban gag clauses that prevent pharmacists from telling patients how to pay the lowest possible price for medication is headed to the President’s desk for signature. This new law will help lower the cost of prescription drugs and save consumers money.

html: The AG made the correct decision to recuse himself from the DOJ investigation into Russia’s attempts to interfere in our elections. The Deputy AG plays a critical role in overseeing the investigation headed by special counsel Mueller.
text: The AG made the correct decision to recuse himself from the DOJ investigation into Russia’s attempts to interfere in our elections. The Deputy AG plays a critical role in overseeing the investigation headed by special counsel Mueller.

html: I’m very concerned by reports that Deputy AG Rosenstein will either be fired or forced to resign.

html: 17 years ago, I joined my colleagues on the Capitol steps where we sang “God Bless America” in the wake of the terrorist attacks on our country. We gathered together in a demonstration of resolve & patriotism, not as Republicans & Democrats but as Americans.
text: 17 years ago, I joined my colleagues on the Capitol steps where we sang “God Bless America” in the wake of the terrorist attacks on our country. We gathered together in a demonstration of resolve & patriotism, not as Republicans & Democrats but as Americans.

html: In what seemed like a moment, September 11th was transformed from a day like any other into one that, forever, will stand alone. html: Many border communities are truly intertwined. Canadian nurses, for example, cross the border every day to work in Maine hospitals. A Madawaska, Maine, mill pumps pulp from the Canadian side of the border to be made into paper on the US side. We must preserve this friendship. 2/2

html: When Katherine Freund’s 3-yr-old son was seriously injured by an 84-yr-old driver in 1988, she reacted in a way that was inspiring. html: I am deeply saddened to learn Cpl. Eugene Cole was killed in the line of duty in Norridgewock this morning. Cpl. Cole served the citizens of Somerset County for 13 years with honor & distinction, & Maine will be eternally grateful for his brave actions to protect his community.
text: I am deeply saddened to learn Cpl. Eugene Cole was killed in the line of duty in Norridgewock this morning. Cpl. Cole served the citizens of Somerset County for 13 years with honor & distinction, & Maine will be eternally grateful for his brave actions to protect his community.

html: Every summer for more than 20 years, I have visited President and Mrs. Bush at their Kennebunkport home. It was always one of the highlights of the year. I shall miss those delightful visits with her. My heart goes out to President Bush and to the entire family. (3/3)

html: At an Intel hearing this morning, I pressed industry leaders about their responsibility to continuously evaluate their employees & report any changes in behavior that should trigger a review of their security clearance. (3/3)
text: At an Intel hearing this morning, I pressed industry leaders about their responsibility to continuously evaluate their employees & report any changes in behavior that should trigger a review of their security clearance. (3/3)

html: Under the current security clearance system, however, contractors’ clearances are not subject to a continuous evaluation. B/c there isn’t an automated, constant review process, things get missed, breaches occur, & reviews aren’t always triggered when they should be. (2/3)
text: Under the current security clearance system, however, contractors’ clearances are not subject to a continuous evaluation.  B/c there isn’t an automated, constant review process, things get missed, breaches occur, & reviews aren’t always triggered when they should be. (2/3)

html: There have been 3 widely reported & serious breaches at the NSA that have threatened our national security. Each one involved government contractors w/ security clearances who have access to highly sensitive gov’t info. (1/3)pic.twitter.com/SfWftLuVEw
text: There have been 3 widely reported & serious breaches at the NSA that have threatened our national security.  Each one involved government contractors w/ security clearances who have access to highly sensitive gov’t info. (1/3)pic.twitter.com/SfWftLuVEw

html: In 37 states including Maine, state law enforcement is not alerted when prohibited individuals try to buy guns. To help stop dangerous people from obtaining guns illegally, I cosponsored a bill requiring the federal gov’t to notify states when someone fails a background check.pic.twitter.com/k4WDe4ZoJV
text: In 37 states including Maine, state law enforcement is not alerted when prohibited individuals try to buy guns. html: The Senate bill will include my amendment to reduce the threshold for deducting medical expenses, which helps people with high medical costs, particularly seniors & people with chronic conditions. 8.8 million Americans use this deduction, half with incomes of $50,000 or less.
